title: What's News: World-Wide
text:
The CDC will be restructured to strengthen its response to public-health threats, the agency's director said, acknowledging shortcomings in its fight against the Covid-19 pandemic.

A judge ordered the owners of CVS, Walgreens and Walmart pharmacies to pay $650 million over 15 years to two Ohio counties after they were found liable for contributing to the opioid crisis.

Russia's intelligence services were hunting for saboteurs in Crimea after an explosion at an ammunition depot rattled Moscow's grip on the peninsula.

The U.S. said that it and Taiwan will start formal negotiations for a bilateral trade and investment initiative in the fall to deepen ties on a range of issues.

Iranian demands for guarantees from the U.S. have once again stalled efforts to revive the 2015 nuclear agreement.

What's News: World-Wide
